config.name: Kit Formerly ConvertKit
config.description: Kit is a platform for creating and sending email campaigns.

auth_config.name: api_key
auth_config.label: API Key
auth_config.message: API Key is used for accessing the API.

auth_config.name: api_secret
auth_config.label: API Secret
auth_config.message: API Secret is used for accessing the API.

page.text: The page of results being requested.

description.text: An internal description of this broadcast

email_address.text: Sending email address leave blank to use your account's default sending email address

email_layout_template.text: Name of the email template to use; leave blank to use your account's default email template

public.text: Specifies whether or not this is a public post

published_at.text: Specifies the time that this post was published (applicable only to public posts)

send_at.text: Time that this broadcast should be sent leave blank to create a draft broadcast. If set to a future time; this is the time that the broadcast will be scheduled to send.

thumbnail_alt.text: Specify the ALT attribute of the public thumbnail image (applicable only to public posts)

thumbnail_url.text: Specify the URL of the thumbnail image to accompany the broadcast post (applicable only to public posts)

public.text: Specifies whether or not this is a public post

published_at.text: Specifies the time that this post was published (applicable only to public posts)

send_at.text: Time that this broadcast should be sent; leave blank to create a "draft" broadcast. If set to a future time; this is the time that the broadcast will be scheduled to send.

thumbnail_alt.text: Specify the ALT attribute of the public thumbnail image (applicable only to public posts)

thumbnail_url.text: Specify the URL of the thumbnail image to accompany the broadcast post (applicable only to public posts)

label.text: The label(s) of the custom field

id.text: The ID of your custom field

fields.text: Object of key/value pairs for custom field(s); The custom field(s) must exist before you can use it here

tags.text: Array of tag ids to subscribe to

sort_order.text: asc to list subscribers added oldest to newest; desc to list subscribers added newest to oldest. asc is the default order.

subscriber_state.text: receive only active subscribers or cancelled subscribers

page.text: the page to retrieve. 50 results are returned per page.
The page of results being requested.Default value is 1.Each page of results will contain up to 50 purchases.

transaction_id.text: A unique ID for the purchase

email_address.text: The subscriber that the purchase belongs to

first_name.text: The first name of the subscriber

transaction_time.text: date and time of purchase as ISO string

sort_order.text: asc to list subscribers added oldest to newest; desc to list subscribers added newest to oldest. asc is the default order.

subscriber_state.text: receive only active subscribers or cancelled subscribers

from.text: Filter subscribers added on or after this date (format yyyy-mm-dd)

to.text: Filter subscribers added on or before this date (format yyyy-mm-dd)

updated_from.text: Filter subscribers who have been updated after this date (format yyyy-mm-dd)

updated_to.text: Filter subscribers who have been updated before this date (format yyyy-mm-dd)

first_name.text: Updated first name for the subscriber.

email_address.text: Updated email address for the subscriber.

fields.text: Updated custom field(s) for your subscriber as object of key/value pairs.The custom field(s) must exist before you can use it here.

tag.text: a JSON object or an array of JSON objects respectively that includes the tag name

routes.text: Remove tag from a subscriber by email
